channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Escobar pub accused of glorifying drug lord's reign of terror
item.description: Colombians in Nottingham say they are disgusted at a new bar that shares the drug lord's surname.

item.title: Covid vaccine: Halifax circus and London festivals in jabs push
item.description: Pop-up vaccine clinics are opening to encourage more people to get vaccinated against Covid-19.

item.title: 'Exploitative' Elephant Man dissection to go ahead
item.description: A replica of Joseph Merrick's body will be dissected at the event.

item.title: Anglo-Saxon coin found in Wiltshire could sell for £200k
item.description: The extremely rare penny is thought to be the only late Anglo-Saxon gold coin in private hands.

item.title: Dorset photographer shoots Star Wars Lego in cinematic style
item.description: A 34-year-old Dorset photographer is recreating cinematic sci-fi scenes using his Star Wars Lego kits.

item.title: 'Bennerley Viaduct has Facebook followers in Germany'
item.description: The Victorian rail bridge was almost demolished but now has fans all over the world.

item.title: Brighton Pride: Gala night kicks off scaled-back festivities
item.description: The launch night will feature an array of acts including cabaret, drag, live music and spoken word.

item.title: Prof Chris Whitty: Man sentenced for St James's Park assault
item.description: Lewis Hughes says he lost his job after assaulting England's chief medical officer in central London.

item.title: Cleveland Bridge: Production resumes as buyer sought
item.description: The Darlington firm has called in administrators, and 200 jobs are potentially at risk.

item.title: Esther Dingley: Remains confirmed as those of missing hiker
item.description: Esther Dingley disappeared in the Pyrenees mountains in November.

item.title: Storm Evert: Falling tree injures women at party as winds rage
item.description: The pair, in their 20s, were believed to have been at an outdoor party when the tree collapsed.

item.title: Baby monkey TikTok rescued from 'miserable life' in Grays
item.description: The marmoset, named after the social media platform, was being kept in a bird cage as a pet.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: Why you shouldn't get a second Covid jab too early
item.description: A government scientific advisor tells Newsbeat why four weeks is too soon between Covid jabs.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: Covid rules: How can the clinically vulnerable stay safe?
item.description: As social-distancing and other Covid rules end in England, how can people who were shielding stay safe?

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings from 19 July?
item.description: Masks are no longer compulsory in England, but remain necessary in Scotland and Wales.

item.title: Jersey teenager asking world leaders for advice
item.description: Leo, 18, sent 200 letters asking for life advice and wisdom from leaders around the globe.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: Beth Shriever parent's 'blown away' by BMX Olympic gold
item.description: Shriever takes first place in the women's BMX race after funding her own qualification campaign.

item.title: 'It put into perspective who my true friends are'
item.description: Jack Fielding, from Bolton, describes his experiences of friendship following his cancer diagnosis.

item.title: Devon teacher brings history lessons to TikTok
item.description: Laurie Matthews has taken her road trip history lessons to TikTok whilst camping in her Fiat 500.

item.title: ‘My dog travelled 50 miles on a bus to Kent’
item.description: Chip the Norfolk terrier jumped on board a double-decker wedding bus by mistake.

item.title: Cambridgeshire Nigel Ebbage murder: Lance Woollard jailed
item.description: Lance Woollard stabbed his daughter's ex-partner 21 times after a long-running custody battle.

item.title: Latitude festival-goers test positive for coronavirus
item.description: The 40,000 people a day Latitude festival is a Covid-19 restrictions test event for the government.

item.title: Brixton stabbing: Man, 18, charged with murder
item.description: Shane Jerome, 23, was pronounced dead at the scene outside Brixton Tube station on 21 July.

item.title: Euro 2020: Wembley steward admits theft over Euro final wristbands
item.description: Yusaf Amin tried to sell security passes, uniforms and wristbands to ticketless fans for £4,500.

item.title: Stonehenge tunnel campaigners win court battle
item.description: A judicial review into road works near the world heritage site finds for the campaigners.

item.title: Mum killed daughter, 3, and cousin in crash while 'showing off'
item.description: Mary Stokes was "showing off" to her five young passengers when she caused the head-on collision.

item.title: Apsana Begum: Labour MP cleared of fraudulent housing claims
item.description: Apsana Begum says the trial caused her "great distress" and damaged her reputation.

item.title: Dog sniffs out cigarette stash hidden in wall
item.description: The hidden compartment was discovered during raids on two stores in Stoke-on-Trent.

item.title: Jordan Lee: Blackpool man who murdered baby daughter jailed
item.description: Jordan Lee was heard shouting at the four-month-old to "shut-up" before severely beating her.

item.title: 'Brighton cat killer' Steven Bouquet jailed for stabbing 16 pets
item.description: Steven Bouquet has been jailed for more than five years after he killed nine cats in night attacks.

item.title: Hastings sewage leak: Bulverhythe beach closed after pipe breaks
item.description: Sewage spilt from a burst pipe for a second time after Southern Water turned on a pumping station.

item.title: Hackney Council IT data blunder 'could have cost lives'
item.description: Hackney Council accidentally made the names and addresses of vulnerable women publicly available.

item.title: Stephen Bear: Reality TV star denies sexual images charges
item.description: Stephen Bear, who won Celebrity Big Brother, denies sharing private images and voyeurism.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Gold for Great Britain in mixed relay events on day eight
item.description: Great Britain kick off a golden Saturday by winning two of the new mixed relay events to take their total medal haul in Tokyo to 28.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Dina Asher-Smith pulls out of 200m after hamstring tear
item.description: Great Britain's world champion Dina Asher-Smith pulls out of the Olympic 200m after revealing she tore her hamstring earlier this month.

item.title: Artingstall claims boxing bronze in Tokyo
item.description: Karriss Artingstall takes Olympic bronze after a narrow defeat by Japan's Sena Irie, while Team GB team-mate Lauren Price beats Panama's Atheyna Bylon to guarantee at least a bronze.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Dina Asher-Smith fails to make 100m final but Daryll Neita through
item.description: Dina Asher-Smith fails to make the 100m final after clocking a below-par 11.05 seconds in the semi-final - but Great Britain team-mate Daryll Neita is through.
